  • Initialize an Operator
  • View page source

Initialize an Operator

Operator is another key class in GAMUT. All algorithms are defined as subclasses of Operator in GAMUT, and they must be initialized with configuration parameters before applying to gamma spectra.

# initialize a Savitzky-Golay smoothing algorithm
savit = gt.SavitzkySmoother(order=2, hwidth=3)
savit.order = 3 # parameters can be modified later

Then Operator objects can be called to apply the algorithms. It should be noted that the number of input spectra must equals to its inp_num attribute, except when inp_num euqals to -1, which means any number of input spectra. Most of Operator objects’ inp_num objects equals to 1. The number of output spectra is always 1.

# apply the Savitzky-Golay smoothing algorithm
smoothed = savit(spectra)

If the inp_num of an Operator object equals to 1, then the pipeline operator » can be used to simplify the initilization and calling. It is also used to call multiple Operator objects consecutively.

# input the spectrum into the operator
smoothed = spec >> gt.SavitzkySmoother(order=2, hwidth=3)# assume that op1, op2, and op3 are three operators of inp_num=1
analyzed = spec >> op1 >> op2 >> op3

Functionor is a special subclass of Operator, which can wrap any function into an Operator object.

# define an operator that combines two spectra
def combine(spec1, spec2):
spec2.regions = deepcopy(spec1.regions)
return spec2
comb = gt.Functionor(inp_num=2, func=combine)
